sentences: Kui õnnetus tuleb, siis tuleb uksest ja aknast.
Häda tuleb alati uksest ja aknast.
context: The word 'uksest' is the ablative case form of 'uks' (door) in Estonian, used to express movement or origin away from something. In this context, it's part of the idiom 'tuleb uksest ja aknast' which means 'comes from doors and windows' - an expression describing something (usually bad things like trouble or misfortune) coming at you from all directions or everywhere simultaneously.
